title: NASA Selects Blue Origin to Launch Mars’ Magnetosphere Study Mission
summary: NASA has awarded Blue Origin, LLC of Kent, Washington a task order to provide launch service for the agency’s Escape and Plasma Acceleration and Dynamics Explorers (ESCAPADE) mission as part of the agency's Venture-Class Acquisition of Dedicated and Rideshare (VADR) launch services contract.

title: SpaceX test-fires 31 engines on Starship’s gigantic Super Heavy booster
summary: In a significant milestone preparing for liftoff of the world’s most powerful rocket, SpaceX test-fired 31 of the booster’s 33 methane-fueled engines Thursday in South Texas as the company eyes a launch attempt as soon as March.

title: SpaceX completes a hot fire test of its massive Super Heavy rocket [Updated]
summary: "The real goal is to not blow up the launch pad, that is success."

title: NASA Launches New Framework for Procurement Ideas, Solutions
summary: NASA is now seeking procurement ideas and solutions to encourage innovation from diverse perspectives, improve reach, reduce barriers, and ultimately meet and exceed agency goals.

title: SpaceX successfully test fires Starship booster in last key step before orbital launch
summary: SpaceX on Thursday test fired 31 of the 33 engines in the towering rocket booster of its Starship prototype, as the company prepares to launch the rocket to orbit for the first time.

title: Starship program conducts major test, firing 31 of 33 Super Heavy engines
summary: SpaceX’s Starship program has reached a major milestone ahead of its historic launch with a static fire test of Booster 7, successfully firing 31 of the booster’s 33 engines for the full planned duration.

title: Investing in Space: Starship in the D.C. spotlight
summary: Good morning from our nation’s capital. I’m in D.C. for the 25th annual Commercial Space Transportation conference. It’s a yearly meeting of a few hundred industry leaders and decision makers, centered around the relationship between one of the sector’s most important regulators and the companies operating within its guidelines.

title: As record rocket launches crowd airspace, the FAA fights to limit travel disruptions
summary: WASHINGTON — Space companies are launching more rockets than ever, ratcheting up competition for air space just as travelers return to flying in droves — and leaving the Federal Aviation Administration in the middle to keep things moving.

title: Russian Progress resupply ship launches on flight to space station
summary: A Russian Soyuz rocket blasted off Thursday from the Baikonur Cosmodrome in Kazakhstan, boosting a Progress resupply ship into orbit in pursuit of the International Space Station with more than 5,500 pounds of cargo, fuel, water, and air.

title: Progress MS-22 resupply ship launches to ISS
summary: Roscosmos has launched its next Progress resupply craft to the International Space Station (ISS). Liftoff of the Progress MS-22 mission occurred at 06:15 UTC on Feb. 9 from Site 31/6 at the Baikonur Cosmodrome in Kazakhstan aboard a Soyuz-2.1a rocket. It will spend two days performing maneuvers until it docks with the ISS on Feb. 11.
